metadata.title: CVE-2014-3180 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** In kernel/compat.c in the Linux kernel before 3.17, as usedin Google Chrome OS and other products, there is a possible out-of-boundsread. restart_syscall uses uninitialized data when restartingcompat_sys_nanosleep. NOTE: this is disputed because the code path isunreachable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3180` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
